channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [LOG4J2-2901] Reconfiguration failed during backend server startup
item.description:
I upgraded both components from log4j-api an log4j-core from 2.11.2 to 2.13.3 and started getting weird errors during the startup of our backend services:

ERROR StatusLogger Reconfiguration failed: No configuration found for '2aae9190' at 'null' in 'null'

As soon I switch back to 2.11.2 it starts working, and logs are created. The error occurs during bootstrapping phase so it does not look like it is bound to any other framework.

log4j2 configuration is present and configured correctly as a properties file. It is bootstrapped with -Dlog4j.configuration property.
item.summary: Reconfiguration failed during backend server startup

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I have a similar issue. I have a a composite configuration with two xml configuration files, one intended to be the default configuration, the other is an optional custom configuration.

When the (optional) custom configuration file does not exist, I've got the exact same error message as reported above, and even the default configuration did not get loaded.

Switching back to 2.12.1 it is working fine, but seems already broken in 2.13.0.

nemethom Have you tried with 2.13.3? I have configured applications with the configurations in Spring Cloud Config as a composite configuration where the first file (the default) exists and the second file does not without any problems.

@Dejan Can you configure a service with -Dlog4j2.debug=true and attach the logs to this issue?

In looking at the code where this log entry is generated it seems that the passed in configuration uri is null. Unfortunately, I have way of telling why that would be.

rgoers Yes, I did. However I do not use Spring Cloud Config. I tried it with a simple java class - doing nothing, but logging at each level from fatal to trace. log4j-api.2.13.3.jar and log4j-core.2.13.3.jar are added to the project build path (eclipse) and I pass the (simple) configuration files to java by the -Dlog4j.configurationFile argument (added to VM arguments in eclipse run configuration). I've also passed -Dlog4j2.debug to java:

When both config files exist than the logging is fine.

However when the second config does not exist, I've got the following exception:

DEBUG StatusLogger Catching

DEBUG StatusLogger Catching java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/medsrv/Develop/EclipseWorkspace/SandBox/src/logconfigC.xml (No such file or directory) at java.base/java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method) at java.base/java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:213) at java.base/java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:155) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.ConfigurationFactory.getInputFromString(ConfigurationFactory.java:371) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.ConfigurationFactory$Factory.getConfiguration(ConfigurationFactory.java:506) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.ConfigurationFactory$Factory.getConfiguration(ConfigurationFactory.java:492) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.ConfigurationFactory$Factory.getConfiguration(ConfigurationFactory.java:405) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.ConfigurationFactory.getConfiguration(ConfigurationFactory.java:323) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext.reconfigure(LoggerContext.java:687) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext.reconfigure(LoggerContext.java:708) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext.start(LoggerContext.java:263) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.impl.Log4jContextFactory.getContext(Log4jContextFactory.java:153) at org.apache.logging.log4j.core.impl.Log4jContextFactory.getContext(Log4jContextFactory.java:45) at org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager.getContext(LogManager.java:194) at org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager.getLogger(LogManager.java:602) at sandBox.LogTest.main(LogTest.java:10)

ERROR StatusLogger Failed to created configuration at /home/medsrv/Develop/EclipseWorkspace/SandBox/src/logconfigC.xml

ERROR StatusLogger Reconfiguration failed: No configuration found for '5bc2b487' at 'null' in 'null'

 

The log entries added to the console indicate 

The strange thing is that I can also reproduce it with older log4j2 versions, too. So it seems I was wrong about this was working with older versions.

OK. I see that when using log4j-spring-cloud-config-client Log4j2CloudConfigLoggingSystem actually handles the composite configuration and has logic to ignore files that don't exist. ConfigurationFactory needs to be modified to behave the same way.

Commit 82dd809b94142078ee2ed1396a6054821120b41a in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/release-2.x from Ralph Goers
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=82dd809 ]

LOG4J2-2901 - Missing configuration files should be ignored when creating a composite configuration

Commit 5f67313e61599fd18452932068afd04e48fb866c in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/master from Ralph Goers
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=5f67313 ]

LOG4J2-2901 - Missing configuration files should be ignored when creating a composite configuration
Fix has been applied. Please verify and close.

Commit 5f67313e61599fd18452932068afd04e48fb866c in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/dependabot/maven/org.apache.maven.plugins-maven-checkstyle-plugin-3.1.1 from Ralph Goers
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=5f67313 ]

LOG4J2-2901 - Missing configuration files should be ignored when creating a composite configuration

Hi rgoers, 

Thanks for fixing it. When is the release of 2.14.0 scheduled?

I downloaded the latest snapshot build, and checked the fix. It worked like a charm for me.

I tried it in a more complex environment, too, involving webapps. I also tried removing the optional config during run, and it picked up the change as expected.

It looks everything is fine.

Thanks.

Hi all, 

I have re-tested this bug again with latest 2.14.0 version but I am experiencing still the same failure. Here some logs from my application:

DEBUG | wrapper | 2021/01/13 09:06:08 | command: "<Java-Path>\java.exe" -Di3s.configFilePath=etc -Dlog4j.configuration=file:etc/log4j2.properties -Dlog4j2.debug=true -Xms20m -Xmx500m -Djava.library.path="lib" -classpath "etc;lib/org/apache/logging/log4j/log4j-api/2.14.0/log4j-api-2.14.0.jar;lib/org/apache/logging/log4j/log4j-core/2.14.0/log4j-core-2.14.0.jar" <My startup class>
DEBUG | wrapper | 2021/01/12 14:56:50 | JVM started (PID=16240)
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/12 14:56:51 | ERROR StatusLogger Reconfiguration failed: No configuration found for '30946e09' at 'null' in 'null'
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/12 14:56:51 | WrapperManager class initialized by thread: main Using classloader: jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader@30946e09

We are using Tanuki Wrapper to run application as a Java service. 

With version 2.11.2 works well but with 2.14.0.
As mentioned in the comment, the same problem is occurring in 2.14.0 release. I have provided exact call and additional information
Once again, please add -Dlog4j2.debug=true and provide the output from those logs.

rgoers Here is a debug log from log4j2:

DEBUG | wrapper | 2021/01/13 09:06:08 | command: "<Java-Path>\java.exe" -Di3s.configFilePath=etc -Dlog4j.configuration=file:etc/log4j2.properties -Dlog4j2.debug=true -Xms20m -Xmx500m -Djava.library.path="lib" -classpath "etc;lib/org/apache/logging/log4j/log4j-api/2.14.0/log4j-api-2.14.0.jar;lib/org/apache/logging/log4j/log4j-core/2.14.0/log4j-core-2.14.0.jar" <My startup class>

DEBUG | wrapper | 2021/01/13 09:06:08 | JVM started (PID=4632)
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Using ShutdownCallbackRegistry class org.apache.logging.log4j.core.util.DefaultShutdownCallbackRegistry
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger AsyncLogger.ThreadNameStrategy=UNCACHED (user specified null, default is UNCACHED)
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | TRACE StatusLogger Using default SystemClock for timestamps.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger org.apache.logging.log4j.core.util.SystemClock supports precise timestamps.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Took 0.109343 seconds to load 216 plugins from jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader@30946e09
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger PluginManager 'Converter' found 44 plugins
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Starting OutputStreamManager SYSTEM_OUT.false.false-1
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Starting LoggerContext[name=30946e09, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext@79079097]...
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Reconfiguration started for context[name=30946e09] at URI null (org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext@79079097) with optional ClassLoader: null
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger PluginManager 'ConfigurationFactory' found 4 plugins
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Missing dependencies for Yaml support, ConfigurationFactory org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.yaml.YamlConfigurationFactory is inactive
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Missing dependencies for Json support, ConfigurationFactory org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.json.JsonConfigurationFactory is inactive
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Using configurationFactory org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.ConfigurationFactory$Factory@6ad82709
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | WARN StatusLogger Invalid URI file:etc/log4j2.properties
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | ERROR StatusLogger Reconfiguration failed: No configuration found for '30946e09' at 'null' in 'null'
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger Shutdown hook enabled. Registering a new one.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | DEBUG StatusLogger LoggerContext[name=30946e09, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext@79079097] started OK.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:10 | WrapperManager class initialized by thread: main Using classloader: jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader@30946e09

And here is your problem

INFO | *jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 09:06:09 | WARN StatusLogger Invalid URI file:etc/log4j2.properties*

I am not sure why the message ends with "*" since your system property does not, but file URLs cannot be relative. They must be of the form 

file://{host}/path

If you want a relative location then just set it to "etc/log4j2.properties"

rgoers

I made mistake in that log as I tried to make it bold. There should not be any * at the end. Changed it in original message.

Nevertheless, tried what you suggested with relative path but it still fails:

DEBUG | wrapper | 2021/01/13 21:09:10 | command: "<Path_to_Java>\java.exe" -Di3s.configFilePath=etc -Dlog4j.configuration=etc/log4j2.properties -Dlog4j2.debug=true -Xms20m -Xmx500m -Djava.library.path="lib" -classpath "etc;lib/org/apache/logging/log4j/log4j-api/2.14.0/log4j-api-2.14.0.jar;lib/org/apache/logging/log4j/log4j-core/2.14.0/log4j-core-2.14.0.jar;<other libs>" <MY_STARTUP_CLASS>
DEBUG | wrapper | 2021/01/13 21:09:10 | JVM started (PID=11424)
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Using ShutdownCallbackRegistry class org.apache.logging.log4j.core.util.DefaultShutdownCallbackRegistry

INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Reconfiguration started for context[name=30946e09] at URI null (org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext@79079097) with optional ClassLoader: null
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger PluginManager 'ConfigurationFactory' found 4 plugins
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Missing dependencies for Yaml support, ConfigurationFactory org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.yaml.YamlConfigurationFactory is inactive
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Missing dependencies for Json support, ConfigurationFactory org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.json.JsonConfigurationFactory is inactive
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Not in a ServletContext environment, thus not loading WebLookup plugin.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Using configurationFactory org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.ConfigurationFactory$Factory@6ad82709
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | ERROR StatusLogger Reconfiguration failed: No configuration found for '30946e09' at 'null' in 'null'
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger Shutdown hook enabled. Registering a new one.
INFO | jvm 1 | 2021/01/13 21:09:11 | DEBUG StatusLogger LoggerContext[name=30946e09, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LoggerContext@79079097] started OK.

 

file:etc/log4j2.properties worked well with 2.11

 

-Dlog4j.configuration=file://etc/log4j2.properties is not working as well.

Ok, this seems to work -Dlog4j.configurationFile=log4j2.properties (as my config file is in a same folder). I think originally this option did not work with some lower version and I apparently switched to -Dlog4j.configuration.
Based on the feedback I am closing this.
